column3: It's been a week since I lost my job.
I lasted a few more months using butter...
But I'm too large for chimneys now.
Did you get chosen for the factory today?
Well, hopefully we have enough for a while.
If you want to spend that coin nows the time.
Do you want to head home?
Do you have a plan for us?
I've been playing my flute recently.
And I have an idea for tomorrow.
Hey, I can't find my watch!!!
...is our last photo of Mom and Dad.
The city is BUSY this morning!
Also try to not get knocked over.
I told you it was the little twerp.
Can you IMAGINE not having parents?
Who would you try and impress??
Only to be told your dreams of...
I think we should wedgie the little twerp!
Those jerks threw the watch off the dock!
Well, the photo is behind glass...
And I thought yesterday was bad.
...very important to me off the dock.
That's a reason to take a drink.
I might have something that'll help.
On this box is one of my old diving suits.
I used them to do repairs back in the Navy.
Also how I lost my leg to Nessy!
Which one of ya is getting in?
He'll do it. I can't afford to get sweaty.
Who knows, the Pompnose girl might see me.
Get in the crane and I'll lower you down
And the photo is dry! Amazing!
What was it like down there?
Before Sailor Pete left we were talking...
...and he was telling me about the docks.
Rumor is there are chests all around!
Although they can be hard to reach.
Pete says we can use his suit.
Heck yes! This will be our best endeavor yet!
We'll sleep on a pile of gold doubloons!
Can't understand you. Take off the suit!
Oh hello there, I was just about to wrap up shop. But..
I have time to make a quick sandwich.
Okay. My brother and I love your sandwiches.
Spare a coin for an old sailor like me...
...and I'll entertain ye with a tale of the sea.
Years ago I was in the Navy on a battleship.
Your loss. It's a good one.
The sky was telling of a storm and we were miles from land.
We had not expected this so we prepared best we could.
The waves tossed the ship as the wind whipped across our faces.
The loudest noise I've ever heard blared as a humongous figure rose from the water...
Suffice to say the ship did not survive the storm. Or my leg.
And with my leg went my military career. They don't have much need of a cripple.
Go ahead and don't believe. *hiccup* But let me tell you.
If I ever lay my eyes on Davey Jones again...
